intro: Thermopsis turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan yellow vetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow, pea-like flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range.
